title: Masala Omelette
steps: Beat eggs with salt and pepper.
Sauté onion, chili, tomato.
Add eggs and cook till set.
Garnish with coriander.

title: Veg Pulao
steps: • Rinse and soak rice for 15 mins.
• Heat ghee, add jeera and onions, sauté lightly.
• Add chopped veggies, salt, and garam masala.
• Add rice, water, cook until rice turns fluffy.

title: Tomato Basil Pasta
steps: • Boil pasta with salt until al dente; drain.
• Sauté garlic in olive oil; add tomato puree.
• Add basil and salt; simmer 5 mins.
• Mix in pasta and toss well before serving.

title: Grilled Paneer Tikka
steps: • Marinate paneer, onion, and capsicum with curd, spices, and salt.
• Skewer pieces alternately and rest for 15 mins.
• Grill or roast until edges are golden.
• Serve hot with mint chutney.

title: Chickpea Salad Bowl
steps: • Mix chickpeas and chopped veggies in a bowl.
• Add olive oil, lemon juice, and salt.
• Toss gently until well combined.
• Serve fresh or chilled.

title: Chicken Stir-fry
steps: • Heat oil; sauté garlic and ginger.
• Add chicken pieces and stir-fry until cooked.
• Mix in onion, capsicum, and soy sauce.
• Cook on high flame for 2–3 mins and serve.

title: Mushroom Fried Rice
steps: • Heat oil and sauté chopped mushrooms.
• Add cooked rice and soy sauce.
• Stir-fry with spring onions and salt.
• Toss well and serve hot.

title: Veg Sandwich
steps: • Spread butter and chutney on bread slices.
• Arrange tomato, cucumber, and onion layers.
• Sprinkle salt and close with another slice.
• Toast lightly or serve plain.

title: Bhindi Sabji
steps: • Wash and slice bhindi; pat dry.
• Heat oil, add onion and sauté till soft.
• Add bhindi, tomato, and spices; cook on low flame.
• Stir occasionally until soft and non-sticky.

title: Schezwan Chicken Wings
steps: • Marinate wings with salt, soy sauce, and schezwan sauce.
• Shallow fry or bake until golden and crispy.
• Toss in hot pan with garlic and extra sauce.
• Garnish and serve hot.

title: Dal Tadka
steps: Rinse 1 cup toor dal thoroughly under running water until the water runs clear. Soak the dal for 15–20 minutes if you have time (optional).

In a pressure cooker or pot, add the rinsed dal with about 3 cups of water, 1/2 tsp turmeric and a pinch of salt. Pressure cook for 3–4 whistles on medium heat (or simmer in a pot until the dal is soft and breaks easily).

Once cooked, mash the dal lightly with the back of a spoon or a whisk to get a slightly creamy texture. Adjust water to reach your desired consistency (thicker or soupier). Keep the dal warm on low heat.
Heat 2–3 tbsp oil in a small pan for the tadka (tempering). Add 1 tsp jeera and let it sputter for a few seconds.
Add finely chopped 1 medium onion and sauté until translucent and lightly golden. Add 2–3 crushed or minced garlic cloves and sauté for 30–45 seconds until fragrant (don't burn).
Add 1 chopped tomato and cook until it softens and oil starts separating from the masala. Add a pinch of turmeric and chopped green chili or red chili powder to taste; cook for another minute.
Pour the hot tadka (onion-tomato-garlic mixture with jeera) into the mashed dal. Stir well and simmer the dal for 3–5 minutes to blend flavors. Taste and adjust salt and chili.
Serve hot with steamed rice or roti. (Optional) garnish with chopped coriander and a squeeze of lemon if available.

title: Curd Rice
steps: • Cook rice until soft and let it cool slightly.
• Mash the rice and mix with curd, milk, and salt.
• Heat oil; add mustard seeds, chopped ginger, and curry leaves.
• Pour the tempering over the curd rice and mix gently.
• Serve chilled or at room temperature.

title: Rava Dosa
steps: • Mix rava, rice flour, maida, cumin, pepper, and salt with water to form a thin batter.
• Rest the batter for 15–20 minutes.
• Pour the batter over a hot tawa and drizzle oil on edges.
• Cook until crispy and golden; serve hot with chutney.

title: Aloo Paratha
steps: • Knead wheat flour dough and rest it for 10 mins.
• Mash boiled potatoes with onion, spices, and salt.
• Stuff potato filling into dough balls and roll into parathas.
• Roast on tawa with ghee until golden brown.

title: Fish Curry
steps: • Marinate fish with salt and turmeric; set aside.
• Sauté onion and tomato; add chili, turmeric, and tamarind extract.
• Add water and simmer to form curry base.
• Add fish pieces and cook until done.

title: Sambar
steps: • Pressure cook toor dal until soft; mash well.
• Boil tamarind water with veggies, salt, and sambar powder.
• Add cooked dal and simmer for 10 minutes.
• Temper with mustard seeds and curry leaves; pour over sambar.

title: Idli
steps: • Grease idli plates and pour in batter.
• Steam for 10–12 minutes until fluffy.
• Let cool slightly and demould carefully.
• Serve with chutney and sambar.

title: Pancakes
steps: • Mix flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt in a bowl.
• Add milk, egg, and melted butter; whisk to smooth batter.
• Pour batter on a greased pan; cook until bubbles form.
• Flip and cook golden on both sides; serve with syrup.

title: Avocado Toast
steps: • Toast bread slices until crisp.
• Mash avocado with lemon juice and salt.
• Spread mixture over toast and sprinkle chili flakes.
• Serve immediately.

title: Egg Fried Rice
steps: • Scramble eggs in a hot pan and set aside.
• Add oil, sauté spring onions, and add cooked rice.
• Mix in soy sauce, salt, and scrambled eggs.
• Stir-fry for 2–3 minutes and serve hot.

title: Tuna Salad
steps: • Combine tuna, chopped veggies, and lettuce in a bowl.
• Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
• Season with salt and toss gently.
• Serve chilled.

title: Palak Paneer
steps: • Blanch spinach and blend into a smooth paste.
• Sauté onion, tomato, and garlic with spices.
• Add spinach puree and simmer for 5 minutes.
• Add paneer cubes, cook briefly, and serve warm.

title: Veg Biryani
steps: • Cook rice till 80% done; set aside.
• Sauté onions and mixed veggies in ghee.
• Add biryani masala and salt; mix well.
• Layer rice and masala, cook on low flame for 10 mins.
